cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 220 miles SE of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly turning west-northwest, then northwest toward the central/upper Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: along the Texas coast between Port Aransas and High Island (near or just southwest of Freeport/Matagorda Peninsula)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Aransas TX to High Island TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Aransas TX to Morgan City LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and upper Texas coast including Matagorda Bay, Galveston Bay, Brazoria County shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph) with gusts possibly reaching minimal hurricane strength as the center nears the coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground level possible along the Freeport/Brazoria County shoreline and in adjacent bays.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches of rain with isolated totals up to 20 inches could produce flash and urban flooding around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, rip currents, and minor coastal erosion; potential channel restrictions due to high water levels.
